Etymology
---------
[Markise](http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Markise) is a German word for awning, as you can (hopefully) recognize in the design.

Logo
----
To replace the logo, just replace the image "logo-48.png" in the "theme/Humarkise/images" directory.

name: myApp theme
Flamingo
tags: theme, responsive, flamingo, mobile optimized theme, html5
description:
2.2.2 UPDATE: Reference fix for background images (again)

2.2.1 UPDATE: Fixed validation errors. Charts are now Classes not ID's

2.1 UPDATE: Fixed references to images in both style sheets. Background images should now work.

2.0 UPDATE: Two themes in one. Change the css file in inc.start.php from style1.css to style2.css. Style2.css is for those who have longer nav items. All responsive just as before.

Flamingo is a theme designed specifically for GetSimple. It has been hand coded using HTML5 Boilerplate as a base to ensure compliance in all current browsers.

Flamingo is a bright, responsive (check it out by resizing your browser and viewing it on your iPad or smartphone) theme that has been geared toward simple portfolio sites. There are only two images used for the whole theme and the rest is CSS3 that degrades gracefully for older browsers.

The theme comes with FancyBox integration. All that is required is to add a class of "fbox" to any element you wish to initiate FancyBox.

For more instructions see <http://robkellas.com/blog/flamingo/>

Feedback welcome.

Thanks,
Rob

description:
FoliSimple Theme for GetSimple CMS

----------------------------------

### ABOUT

A simple and clean portfolio type theme with a fixed top menu bar. Perfect for easy presentation of projects, and suitable for long text blocks as well as wide images.

Uses a simple and clear jquery toggle menu for both a list of project pages and a bio text.

The HTML/CSS is simple and commented where relevant allowing customisation with only basic HTML/CSS knowledge.

name: myCompany theme
tags: theme, mycompany, responsive, css3, html5, pixelofficer
description:
Thank you for using myCompany theme for GetSimple CMS. This theme is HTML5/CSS3 responsive - so you don't have to worry about mobile version layout. This theme is based on HTML5 boiler plate with Modernizr - But i've tried to keep this page as simple as possible (so many features wasn't used) but also modern and good looking. Design is 100% hand-made :) So I hope you like it :)

- Responsive
- HTML5/CSS3
- Multi templates
- Optional breadcrumbs
- Custom Social icons
- Layered PSD for your custom screenshot included
- preformated CSS styles

Version 1.2
Duplicated meta tags and H1 removed

Since Version 1.1 
- Multiple button colors
- Icons for buttons

Demo and support <http://mycompany.pixelofficer.sk>

name: BlueBusiness
tags: getsimple theme, getsimple template, templatka, szablon
description:
BlueBusiness is probably the first, free business-like theme for GetSimple. Theme is html5/css3 ready, supports all latest browsers, and is compatible with most popular i18n plugins.
It has a builtin' slimbox gallery, so you add fancy effects to your images by adding a thumbnail, and linking to full sized image.

This theme is perfect for small companies websites having standard pages like "about us, our offer, contact".

For more instructions, hints, features and a working demo visit: <http://getsimple.wujitsu.pl/bluebusiness>

__Changelog__

* 1.4 - tweaks toward better compatibility with i18n plugins; minor css changes; code optimization
* 1.3 - css improvements (menu, images, etc); code cleanup
* 1.2 - tons of changes, and improvements; full changelog is posted in latest news on [demo     page](http://getsimple.wujitsu.pl/bluebusiness) along with  showcase of popular plugins
* 1.1 - small bugfixes; moving search functionality from component to template
* 1.0 - raw version release

name: Seascape Theme
description:
This is a theme built on the Skeleton grid to make it fully responsive down to small phone screen size. View the demo site here:
<http://timbowgs.bplaced.net/seascape/>


The standard Template follows the Standard GetSimple format  of Title and Tagline, Page and Sidebar. There is also a page template without the sidebar.

The header image can be changed through the GS backend without ftp and without  editing the theme files and pages can be given specific header images the same way.

V1.1 - altered some whitespace values. Gave the ids to divs "maincontent" and "sidebar" for easier selection when styling
V1.2 - made ready for the custom title plugin without editing the templates. Made the footer text editable without editing the templates. Tidied. Added editor.css

name: Clean Slate
tags: starter theme, barebones, oocss, blank theme
description:
#Clean Slate for GetSimple CMS

*Clean Slate* is a bare bones starter theme for [GetSimple CMS](http://www.get-simple.info/ "GetSimple CMS"). It contains some minimal markup and a couple of [OOCSS](https://github.com/stubbornella/oocss/wiki "Object Oriented CSS")-inspired classes to get you started, but that's it.

##Component Dependencies
*Clean Slate* uses components for the theme's tagline and sidebar. If you don't want/need them, just remove the get_component for the tagline and sidebar located in the <code>header.inc.php</code> and <code>sidebar.inc.php</code> files.

###Version 2.0
- Added screenshot and removed a tag.

###Version 1.5
- Added support for media queries and a simple reset.

name: Bootstrap
tags: Bootstrap, responsive, twitter bootstrap, twitter, html5, white
description:
A theme built on [Initializr](http://www.initializr.com/) and [Bootstrap](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/) 2.1.0 and includes all functions and features of the official project.  

3 templates included
1. With a sidebar
2. Wide
3. "Hero" for a simple marketing or informational website. It includes a large callout called the hero unit and three supporting pieces of content. Use it as a starting point to create something more unique.

2.1.0.3 With [LESS](http://lesscss.org/) Support, you are able to download any "variables.less" from [Bootswatch](http://bootswatch.com/) and replace it in the /less/bootstrap folder to apply the new style.
Replace the (less/bootstrap) variables.less file with a file from less/bootswatch folder and rename it to variables.less

2.1.0.4 Fixed some small issues

For beta theme check [Github](https://github.com/simondahla/GetSimpleCMS-Bootstrap-Theme)

name: fresh oranges
CityWide
tags: business, professional, trade, phone,  handheld, responsive, fluid
description:
A business type theme built on the Cardinal theme. Version 2.0 is now variable width and responsive right down to phone screen size.

The current header image is a view of the beautiful city of Bath which you can replace with a picture of your own down at heel shabby hometown if you wish.

name: LCARS-Next-Gen
description:
LCARS-Next-Gen is a theme for the Get Simple CMS. It is designed to resemble the computer displays from the *Enterprise-D* (NCC-1701D) from *Star Trek: The Next Generation*.

It is written in HTML5 and CSS3, uses a custom font for display headings, and supports both get_header() and get_footer() hooks. It also includes the HTML shim, enabling support of HTML5 elements in Internet Explorer 6-9. It includes a single navigation bar and dual sidebars to the right of the main content area.

It also includes a custom font that replicates the appearance of the text.

It is printer friendly, printing the content only (specifically, the header, navigation menu, footer, and sidebars will not print). Additionally, if you are using the SA GS Admin Toolbar, those links will not print.

You can view a live demo here:

<http://www.kjodle.net/getsimple/lcars/>

name: Bootstrap Theme
description:
**Note: the screenshot on Extend is outdated.**

## About
Bootstrap Theme is a simple [GetSimple CMS](http://get-simple.info/) theme based on [Bootstrap](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/).

Note: My website no longer runs GetSimple so I am going to stop updating this theme. Remember you can always contribute to the project yourself on  [GitHub](https://github.com/MasterMic/bootstrap-theme)!

It aims to be *easily extendable* and *minimalistic*.

## New in 1.4
- Updated to Bootstrap 1.4
- Final update :(

## New in 1.3
- Removed extra Bootstrap styles (gradients, etc.) (bootstrap-theme.min.css)
- Added a custom css file (custom.css) that you can use to override or add new css rules to

## New in 1.2
- Fixed mismatched tags
- Made the brand a link again

## New in 1.1
- Removed extra padding that was in the navigation bar (why was it there?)

## New in 1.0
- Updated the styling to use Bootstrap 3
- Removed the faded background in the side column

## GitHub Repository
Feel free to contribute to the theme on [GitHub](https://github.com/MasterMic/bootstrap-theme).

name: GSkeleton
description:
This is the responsive boilerplate Skeleton by Dave Gamache made ready for GetSimple.

"A Beautiful Boilerplate for Responsive, Mobile-Friendly Development. 
Skeleton is a small collection of CSS files that can help you rapidly develop sites that look beautiful at any size, be it a 17" laptop screen or an iPhone. "

[Demo Site Here](http://timbowgs.bplaced.net/GSkeleton/)

I have added a nav menu and a footer with minimal styling so the theme works straight out of the box, but the intention is that it should be used as a basis for building, editing and restyling.

The Skeleton code is much, much simpler than Bootstrap. there is no jquery and no javascript, just a nice efficient css grid which is easy to use and edit. Ideal for GetSimple, and really good for making existing sites responsive.

V1.1  Removed a margin-top declaration which had caused me grief. All skeleton block elements have bottom spacing for a good reason it turns out. Removed some inline style declarations and put them in the css where they belong. Also gave the template some html5 nomenclature: 'section', 'nav', 'aside' etc.

V1.2 Corrected missing semi-colon in footer

name: Freedom (Scrolling)
tags: linux, ubuntu, simple, clean, purple, orange, grey
description:
**DEMO: <http://mattharwood.com/freedom-demo>**

Freedom is an Ubuntu-inspired theme for Get Simple. It is simple but pleasing, using the Ubuntu font and colours.

**This new, updated version (1.1) includes independent scrolling of the content, keeping the newly left-aligned sidebar in place as the visitor reads your content.**

Other small updates include a blog.php template, aiming to remove the title of the page used for News Manager, as it looked slightly disjointed and busy.

The CSS has also been tidied up slightly, with headings now having more consistent padding.

Main points:
+ Includes settings for Twitter/Google+/RSS icons in the sidebar
+ Nice, clean typography
+ Fast (almost no images)

**Important: Settings**
You will want to edit the settings available at the top of template.php and blog.php - these include the logo and social media URLS.

You may also want to set the template for the page you use for News Manager (if used!) to blog.php

Please let me know where you're using it, and any other feedback! matt@mattharwood.com is my email address.

Thank you!

description:
GST Impress is our latest dive into the skunkworks here at GetSimpleThemes. Reinventing the way we use GetSimpleCMS, simply put - redefining CMS.

GST-Impress is based upon the fantastic work by Bartaz with the plugin Impress.js. GST-Impress allows GetSimpleCMS users to quickly and easily create fantastic presentations with total flexibility.

Some of the theme’s features include:

Complete customisation of slides position (X,Y,Z axis position and rotation).
Able to scale pages inherently using page option.
Theme includes the usage of 'variables' enabling page positioning to be inter-related.

Demo: http://gst-impress.getsimplethemes.com/
Further Info and Download: http://www.getsimplethemes.com/themes/gst-impress

name: BlackSimpleExtended
description:
This is a modified version of the [BlackSimple](http://get-simple.info/extend/theme/blacksimple/566/) theme. I have extended it to incorporate the functionality of both the [Child Menu](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/child-menu/40/) and the [i18n](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/i18n/69/) plugin in a way, that, (in my opinion) resembles the look and feel of the original theme very well. 

If i18n_navigation is installed and active this will be used for displaying the nested menu for child pages. Otherwise Child Menu will be utilized for that purpose. 
So the choice is up to you ;-)

Moreover the theme offers several different templates for displaying or hiding the child menu or the sidebar on certain pages.

There have been several css modifications, which include:

-  differently sized headings for clearer hierarchy
-  a wider content area (-> smaller sidebar)
-  proper display of lists in the content area (ul + ol)
-  optimized style of search results from [i18n_search](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/i18n-search/82/)

For the best experience possible you should also install the [Current Parent](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/current-parent/764/) plugin, so the highlight of the parent page wont disappear after a child has been selected.


CREDITS
========
Kudos to [Tristar Web Design](http://www.tristarwebdesign.co.uk/) for the original design and [Artur G?ówczy?ski](http://www.artglow.me) for porting the theme to GetSimple.

name: PureBootstrap
tags: theme, pure, bootstrap, bootswatch, fontawesome, font, awesome, html5, css3, jquery, retina, js, validator, validation
description:
A simple and highly customizable theme built purely on the wonderful Bootstrap framework. This theme will allow you to create many great looking websites.

PureBootstrap features 5 basic templates for you to build on:

- Default - Includes fixed width body with page title and breadcrumbs bar.
- blank - A completely blank template so that you can create your own full width content.
- blog - Designed especially for Blogs, it includes a sidebar with search, categories and archive.
- sidebar-l - Similar to 'Default', but has a sidebar on the left. Sidebar content can be edited in sidebar.inc.php
- sidebar-r - Same as 'sidebar-l', but with the sidebar on the opposing side.

This theme also has its own custom function to give it support for a number of plugins, including:

- Custom Title
- i18n Navigation
- SimpleBreadcrumbs v1.0+
- GetSimple Blog v1.4 & v3.x
- GetSimple Blog 4.0+ (Yet to be released)

_More information about this plugin, including what the future holds for it, the changelog , plus the main documentation can be found on my website. Visit the forum page for the links._

In this theme you can setup a mini shop page with de help of Special Pages plugin. The mini shop was builded with the help of [simpleCartjs
](http://simplecartjs.org/) javascript shopping cart, and for more information and customization read the [documentation](http://simplecartjs.org/documentation) of script.

Like this theme to work **must install** the [I18N Search](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/i18n-search/82/), [I18N](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/i18n/69/), [I18N Special Pages](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/i18n-special-pages/319/) and the [Theme Settings](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/theme-settings/840/) plugin, all this plugins by [Mvlcek](http://mvlcek.bplaced.net/), and the [Admin Header Footer](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/admin-header-footer/10/) plugin by [ccagle8](http://www.cagintranet.com/) For more information on how to use this plugins view the Support forum, or the developer website. 

All images will be loaded in [Jack Moore's](http://www.jacklmoore.com/colorbox/) colorbox.

name: BootSimple
description:
BootSimple is a small responsive theme based on Bootstrap 3.3.2. Its very small (only 3 files, about 8kB and a screenshot) and supports submenu's (1 level) out of the box. No plugins needed. Bootstrap itself is loaded from CDN.

File description:
template.php is based on a Bootstrap example from their website with some additions of the Getsimple tag's. functions.php implements a replacement for the get_navigation tag by get_bootsimple_navigation($currentpage).
bootsimple.jpg is the header picture which you can replace by your own.

I made this theme just to play a little with GetSimple, PHP and Bootstrap. For a beginner the plugins of other themes can be very overwhelming. So maybe this "Simple" theme will give people some stuff to play with.

I'm not a experienced PHP programmer so I maybe it is not a good idea to use this theme on a proffesional site (functions.php is very inefficient but should be "Simple" to understand).

Update: Removed double get_header().
Update Feb 20, 2015: Include screenshot and changed template.php so that is is valid html5 code.
Update April 1, 2015: Updated Bootstrap from 3.3.2 to 3.3.4.  Removed error from functions.php (gave html validation error when using parentmenu-items). Linked navbrand link that was empty, to Homepage.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
This simple gallery script demonstrates how to use ItemManager 2.3.3 > to create pretty image galleries like this:

I used following jQuery plugins to create js. effects and animations in frontend [http://miromannino.github.io/Justified-Gallery/](http://miromannino.github.io/Justified-Gallery/) and [http://www.jacklmoore.com/colorbox/](http://www.jacklmoore.com/colorbox/)

name: Verti
description:
All credit for design to htm5up.net . This is a straight conversion of their template. My demo of the GS theme is here: <http://www.gs.cyberpress.biz/verti/>

Responsive, for any screen size.

Features 3 levels of nav by drop down and fly-out plus a mobile javascript hamburger menu all working. Also a full fontawesome icon set.

Four page templates are sidebar left and right plus no sidebar, also the homepage. Templates are all partial files, like in Innovation or wordpress.

Version 1.1: jquery link in templates moved to the <head> so I18NGallery plugin works. Wise to turn off jquery in the plugin settings.

name: CityLights
tags: responsive, html5, css3, mobile, first, dark, bright, neon
description:
A responsive two-column theme based on [bootstrap](http://getbootstrap.com/).

**Features**

* responsive
* mobile-first
* HTML5, CSS3
* includes a full page template
* custom landing page / call to action (see installation instructions)

With the [corresponding plugin](http://get-simple.info/extend/plugin/citylightsplugin/1055/), this theme also supports:

* custom background image
* branding logo
* social media icons

**Demo**

See a demo [here](http://owentosh.com/citylights/).

**Version Notes**

1.0 - Initial version

name: Millg
description:
A new theme based on the Milligram css-framework. It's very minimal, so you can build onto it.

It's using css3 flexbox for some of the positioning. The whole grid in the framework is based on it, but here it's only used for positioning the nav and footer.

The style folder has a milligram.css file, a millimin.css (minified and linked to the template) and a style.css (my edits, specific to this theme).

More info on the Milligram css-framework: <https://milligram.github.io/>

Theme is tested on GS v.3.3.11 and 3.4 alpha


### Release changes: ###

Version 1.1: Added Viewport meta tag

name: Spectral
Saturn
description:
Saturn is a simple, one-column theme for GetSimple. The combination of white and orange colours makes this theme looking neat. Original HTML template was made by Afnizar Nur Ghifari, I adapted it for GetSimple CMS.

**Saturn** supports following components:

1. FontAwesome icons
2. Kube CSS Framework
3. Two sidebar components below the content
4. Responsive design

**Theme demo**: [click here](http://gs.glowczynski.pl/demos/Saturn)

For help, addons and components **go to my GetSimple Knowledge Base**: [click here](http://gs.glowczynski.pl)

name: Ocean
description: This GetSimple Theme is a fully responsive basic theme built with jQuery and has 4 page templates. It is easy to customize with a basic understanding of css. A ‘custom-styles.css’ is included after all other stylesheets and can be found in a folder named ‘custom’, making it easy to change design elements of your website. Please report any bugs or problems to <http://www.blenderbrush.com/portfolio-item/ocean>

name: GS Editorial
GS Dimension
description:
My demo is here
<http://www.gs.cyberpress.biz/dimension/>

Another html5up template made ready for GetSimple.

I think this is a really neat theme for a small business, a personal homepage, a resume, or a 'web presence' . I haven't tested it with plugins but I presume it will take a gallery. The contact form works just as it is with formspree. Really nice transitions and totally good for phones and tablets.

The html is structured as a single page site although it doesn't function like one. I used the famous Carlos Code so that it works without a plugin but you do have to just change the custom permalink in Settings to #%slug% and remember the index page has no content of its own and needs to be taken out of the menu. The site won't be working properly until you have done that and made at least one new page. The background image is theme/Dimension/images/bg.jpg .
